messages.content:
Can you tell me if Bilal Ghalib has a room compensated for in the conference based on the information in this email thread:

Bilal Ghalib <bilal@bloom.pm>

Re: WISE In Person Gathering 2023: Payment Process 7 messages

David Munir Nabti <dmn@bloom.pm>Wed, Mar 1, 2023 at 7:39 AM

To: Alejandra Garza <alejandra@wellbeing-project.org>, Silvana de Cisneros <silvana@wellbeing-project.org>

Cc: Dara Mouracade <dara@bloom.pm>, Habib Tawk <habib@bloom.pm>, Bilal Ghalib <bilal@bloom.pm>

Hi Alejandra and Silvana,Â 

I hope all is going well! :-) It's been lovely engaging with the group, and we're looking forward to more connections, collaborations, and impact going forward.Â 

A quick note regarding the in-person gathering: We would love to attend, but are now a bit short financially since a few of our main projects closed, and we're adjusting to some of the critical challenges in Lebanon/etc and how to best support our team and teams in our programs in these contexts. We're in discussions with some partners/donors for additional projects, but we're not sure when those will come through, or at what scale. If there is possibility for financial support to attend the gatheringÂ in July, that would be much appreciated. ğŸ™Â 

Thanks so much for your efforts to make this an inclusive gathering. Please let us know your thoughts on that, how best to approach that, etc.Â 

Thanks again and best wishes,Â 

DMN

(David) Munir Nabti CEO/GM, Startup Trainer, Innovation/Policy Advisor

Help us grow our impact:Â www.bloom.pm/donate

We're hiring:Â www.bloom.pm/jointheteam

Get updates & opportunities in ourÂ twice-monthly newsletter.

Â  Â  Â 

BloomÂ runs high quality data-driven online and hybrid entrepreneurship, social enterprise, and skill development programs.Â (Bloom is an affiliate of AltCity Impact, a registered non-profit based in Lebanon.)Â Â 

On Tue, Feb 21, 2023 at 10:16â€¯PM Alejandra Garza <alejandra@wellbeing-project.org> wrote:

Hello, we hope that this email finds you well.

We are delighted that you have confirmed your attendance to our in-person gathering this July in Switzerland! We're deeply grateful for your participation and commitment to The WISE Network and The Wellbeing Project's community. It has been a beautiful space for all of us, and we thank you for being part of making it special.

The all-inclusive price to attend the gathering at Caux Palace is 720â‚¬ + VAT (21%) per person (includes applicable taxes) which covers your 3 nights of lodging and food July 6-9, 2023. Please follow these steps to complete your payment before April 15th, 2023 to guarantee your spot to our event.Â 

Cancellation Policy:

For cancellations before April 6th: 100% refund

For cancellations after April 7th: no refund

Additionally, please take a look at the Caux Palace Guidelines and reach out if you have any other questions, we are happy to support you with anything that you may need.

You can see if your passport requires a visa in the list of countries here. We can gladly help generate a personalized invitation letter for you too, please reach out to Ale (alejandra@wellbeing-project.org) if needed for your visa application.

Thank you in advance for your time. We very much look forward to confirming your attendance upon receiving your payment.

And most of all, we look forward to seeing you in Switzerland!

With much warmth,

The WISE Network Team

--

ALEJANDRA GARZA

Networks Advancement ManagerÂ 

www.wellbeing-project.org

Co-Created with Ashoka, Georgetown University, Impact Hub, Porticus, Skoll Foundation, Synergos

Watch the replays of the Wellbeing Summit for Social Change

Alejandra Garza <alejandra@wellbeing-project.org>Fri, Mar 10, 2023 at 7:48 PM

To: David Munir Nabti <dmn@bloom.pm>

Cc: Silvana de Cisneros <silvana@wellbeing-project.org>, Dara Mouracade <dara@bloom.pm>, Habib Tawk <habib@bloom.pm>, Bilal Ghalib <bilal@bloom.pm>

Hi David!Â I hope that you are having a wonderful day. I apologize for my tardiness in responding, the last 10 days have been hectic with travel but I am back now.

We reviewed this with our internal team and are glad to share that The Wellbeing Project can cover your accommodation (1 person, food and lodging, 3 nights & 4 days) for the WISE Gathering in Caux Palace this July. Do you think that, with this support, you would be able to pay for your roundtrip flight?

Please let us know if this scenario could work for you, we are a small nonprofit but are honored to be able to help you in this way. We truly value having you as a member of the WISE Network.

Additionally, as we said in earlier emailsÂ if you have any ideas regarding fundraising please reach out to us and we can discuss further.

We look forward to your response,Â 

And most of all, we look forward to meeting in July! With much warmth,

[Quoted text hidden]

David Munir Nabti <dmn@bloom.pm>Tue, Mar 14, 2023 at 7:39 AM

To: Dara Mouracade <dara@bloom.pm>, Habib Tawk <habib@bloom.pm>, Bilal Ghalib <bilal@bloom.pm>

Hi Dara and Habib,Â 

Before we respond to them ... can you quickly update me on your involvement with WISE and the working groups you're a part of? How is that stuff going?Â 

I've added brief notes in the "WISE (Wellbeing Project) - Bloom Internal Notes Start Here" (though I don't have for all meetings, but a few are there, and let's work to aggregate that stuff there or somewhere ... can you add in brief notes in there? Or do we have a separate doc where we have notes?Â 

Obviously preference is to get more of us out to this gathering ... so hopefully we can figure out how to make that happen.Â 

Thanks much!Â 

[Quoted text hidden]

David Munir Nabti <dmn@bloom.pm>Wed, Apr 5, 2023 at 8:33 AM

To: Alejandra Garza <alejandra@wellbeing-project.org>

Cc: Silvana de Cisneros <silvana@wellbeing-project.org>, Dara Mouracade <dara@bloom.pm>, Habib Tawk <habib@bloom.pm>, Bilal Ghalib <bilal@bloom.pm>

Hi Alejandra and Silvana,Â 

First off, apologies for delays in responding to this. We discussed internally, and then got caught up in some other deadlines.Â 

Second of all, thanks for the offer and invitation, and we're happy to accept. If you folks seem to find additional funds available (or if our financial situation improves), we'd love to have an additional 1-2Â people attend, and we're exploring shifting things around internally to help us participate more in the WISE efforts, and build towards more collaborations with the community of partners.Â 

We'd also be happy to support in other ways, in terms of helping facilitate sessions, leading workshops, etc. For example, we're doing some really interesting experiments in how to integrate AI into our programs and platform, and leverage AI to help support NI (natural/human intelligence), and help people and programs understand the complex needs and priorities of individuals and teams and suggest possible next-best activities for growth. Perhaps it could be of interest to do some sort of workshop on AI with the participants, and help them think of how they could leverage AI in their institutions and efforts to promote wellbeing. (We're working on other interesting efforts related to wellbeing assessments, data, facilitation techniques, etc as well.) We're all experimenting with those things on the team, and Bilal is leading some exciting efforts as well, so perhaps we could do a joint workshop on that, or explore some other way to share that info with people in the WISE community.Â 

In terms of fundraising, we'll think about that as well, and also the idea came up a few times of jointly applying to RFPs/developing projects with WISE partners to guide towards implementing activities and conducting action-oriented research, but we haven't taken action yet on that. If you folks have any ideas for that, or know of possible RFPs that we could develop some consortium around, please let us know and we can see how to follow up on that.Â 

Thanks again for your efforts! Step by step! :-)Â 

Best wishes,Â 

DMNÂ 

(David) Munir Nabti CEO/GM, Startup Trainer, Innovation/Policy Advisor

Help us grow our impact:Â www.bloom.pm/donate

We're hiring:Â www.bloom.pm/jointheteam

Get updates & opportunities in ourÂ twice-monthly newsletter.

Â  Â  Â 

BloomÂ runs high quality data-driven online and hybrid entrepreneurship, social enterprise, and skill development programs.Â (Bloom is an affiliate of AltCity Impact, a registered non-profit based in Lebanon.)Â Â 

[Quoted text hidden]

Alejandra Garza <alejandra@wellbeing-project.org>Mon, Apr 10, 2023 at 9:05 PM

To: David Munir Nabti <dmn@bloom.pm>

Cc: Silvana de Cisneros <silvana@wellbeing-project.org>, Dara Mouracade <dara@bloom.pm>, Habib Tawk <habib@bloom.pm>, Bilal Ghalib <bilal@bloom.pm>

Hi again David! Thank you so much for reaching out. We are honored to read that this support from our part can help you attend the gathering! We are glad to be able to help in this way and to see you in Switzerland!

We hope to have additional news for helping more membersÂ by the end of this month / early may. We are trying to do the best we can under our limitations / capabilities, and are trying to help at least 1 person from each institutionÂ to attend. Regarding the workshop, thank you for volunteering! We are in the process of developing the agenda for Switzerland and will let you know once we have news for participation of this kind. Also, a workshop on fundraising or exploring how we can all fundraise would be a great idea too! A lot of members have mentioned interest in this but none knows where / how to start.. maybe we couldÂ have a space for brainstorming on this in Switzerland and even a WG could arise from this, who knows!

Thanks again for reaching out and for all of the Bloom team's enthusiasm around WISE!

Wishing you all a beautiful week ahead,

Warmly,Â 

[Quoted text hidden]

David Munir Nabti <dmn@bloom.pm>Wed, Jun 7, 2023 at 2:24 PM

To: Alejandra Garza <alejandra@wellbeing-project.org>, Silvana de Cisneros <silvana@wellbeing-project.org>

Cc: Bilal Ghalib <bilal@bloom.pm>, Dara Mouracade <dara@bloom.pm>

Hi Alejandra and Silvana,Â 

Sounds great all around, and I'm adding in Dara and Bilal here to keep them in the loop.Â 

As for the gathering in Geneva, I'll check if either of us will have aÂ +1 along. (Bilal, theÂ Caux Palace Guidelines are here).

As for the fundraising efforts, sure sounds good. I'm familiar with and have organized unconferences before :-) , and I'll see what I / we can do to prepare for that before the gathering.Â 

As for a community coffee before the gathering ... I think that's cool as well, and happy to support / facilitate again if you want, and build on what we did last time, and probably adapt it to help people get the most out of theÂ GenevaÂ gathering, since it's quite close ... maybe introduce the unconferenceÂ approach, help people think of topics, etc? Let us know what you decide on that and we can go from there.Â 

As for the regional summits, is there any more information you can share on that? How those are working, financial arrangements, etc? I'd love to explore whether it's possibleÂ to organize a MENA one as well, and maybe have it a mix of online+in-person? Or complementary gatherings? We know some good people and groups that could potentially collaborate on that.Â 

As for June 13, I'm facilitating a session that overlaps with the first 30 minutes or so ... so I'll join a bit late, but look forward to it. :-)Â 

Cheers! :-)Â 

(David) Munir Nabti CEO/GM, Startup Trainer, Innovation/Policy Advisor

Help us grow our impact:Â www.bloom.pm/donate

We're hiring:Â www.bloom.pm/jointheteam

Get updates & opportunities in ourÂ twice-monthly newsletter.

Â  Â  Â 

BloomÂ runs high quality data-driven online and hybrid entrepreneurship, social enterprise, and skill development programs.Â (Bloom is an affiliate of AltCity Impact, a registered non-profit based in Lebanon.)Â Â 

On Wed, Jun 7, 2023 at 12:53â€¯AM Alejandra Garza <alejandra@wellbeing-project.org> wrote:

So happy to hear from you David, I hope that you are well! We are thrilled to read that Bilal will be attending as well!

Regarding your sponsorship, that is correct, we will cover both your accommodationsÂ (food and lodging for July 6-9th, starting with lunch July 6th and ending with breakfast July 9th). You must cover your costs regarding travel. Any extra costs like double occupancy for the rooms or extra meals must be covered by you as well, if interested. I can put you in touch with Caux Palace so that you guys can pay for that through them.

About the fundraising efforts, we agree and would enjoy having a space for that in our Gathering. We will share more on our June 13th call with the network, the idea is to build some parts of our agenda for Switzerland together and have multiple activitiesÂ where people can join / pitch inÂ according to each person's interests. This will happen until we're together in Caux Palace, it is a framework called "unconferencing" that Ken Elston will share next week in our call, and members can volunteer to lead certain sessions. We will also have time in Switzerland to work on what the WGs have been discussing, I imagine you could volunteer for this fundraising topic, which has been talked about in both the Community and Documentation WGs. I would say we could wait to have the June 13th call and then see if a call is necessary. What do you think?

We also want to see if another informal coffee break can take place by JuneÂ  20-27 before Switzerland, we'll see how the Online Gathering goes and decide if this would be a good idea :)Â  About the event in Dubai, we would be glad to get to know more! Let us know if there is anythingÂ we can do to keep that conversation going and explore possible collaborations.Â  Lastly, what Bilal mentioned to you about our distributed "Wellbeing Conferences" - do you mean our regional wellbeing summits? If it's the case, then yes! Some Wellbeing Project members and partners are hosting several regional summits, replicating what we experienced in Bilbao! There are 5 happening this year, please see below:

I hope this information helps! We would be glad to jump in a call with you as well if you'd like.

Looking forward to seeing you guys in the Online gathering call June 13th as well as in Switzerland!

Warm hug!

Based on the information provided in the email thread, Bilal Ghalib's room has been compensated for the conference. Alejandra Garza from The Wellbeing Project confirmed in her message dated March 10, 2023, that they could cover accommodation (1 person, food and lodging, 3 nights & 4 days) for the WISE Gathering in Caux Palace. This message was directly addressed to David Munir Nabti, but Bilal Ghalib was included in the CC list.

Later in the thread, on June 7, 2023, Alejandra Garza expressed that she was thrilled to read that Bilal will be attending the event as well. The sponsorship was also confirmed again in the last email, stating that they will cover both attendees' accommodations (food and lodging for July 6-9th).

So, yes, Bilal Ghalib does have a room compensated for at the conference.
